name: Lateral Connectivity for Riparian Fauna
functionStatement: Continuous pathways for free movement of water, sediment, and organisms supporting recolonization, maintaining species diversity, and enabling recovery.
descriptionMarkdown: Floodplain/wetlands accessible for semiaquatic fauna unless steep canyons preclude it.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Map levees or berms along the corridor and summarize continuous barrier length. Confirm passable gaps where present.

inputs.label: Lateral Connectivity for Riparian Fauna
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: No major levees or walls and free lateral movement. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some partial barriers with remaining access. / Large levees hamper movement in many areas. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Heavily walled or leveed corridor with minimal lateral connectivity. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence
